Bit-7 Description: SRC_DRDY: 0 – new set of XYZ acceleration and temperature data is not available, 1 – new set of XYZ acceleration and temperature data is available
Bit-6 Description: SRC_OVF: 0 – No overflow condition detected, 1 – Overflow condition detected
Bit-5 Description: SRC_BUF: 0 – No output buffer event status flags are active, 1 – One or more buffer event status flags are active
Bit-4 Description: SRC_SDCD_OT: 0 –  No SDCD outside of thresholds event has been detected, 1 –  An SDCD outside of thresholds event has been detected
Bit-3 Description: SRC_SDCD_WT: 0 –  No SDCD within thresholds event has been detected, 1 – An SDCD within thresholds event has been detected
Bit-2 Description: SRC_ORIENT: 0 – No orientation change event has occurred, 1 – An orientation change event has occurred
Bit-1 Description: SRC_ASLP: 0 – A WAKE-to-SLEEP or SLEEP-to-WAKE system operating mode transition has not occurred, 1 – A WAKE-to-SLEEP or SLEEP-to-WAKE system operating mode transition has occurred
column21: SRC_BOOT: 0 – Boot sequence in process/not complete, 1 – Boot sequence completed

Bit-7 Description: TEMP_OUT[7:0]:8-bit 2's complement temperature value (value + 25)DegC
VECM[7:0]:LSB of the 12-bit unsigned acceleration vector modulus result
VECM[11:8]:MSB of the 12-bit unsigned acceleration vector modulus result
OUT_X[7:0]:LSB of the 12-bit X-axis output acceleration data in 2s complement
OUT_X[11:8]:MSB of the 12-bit X-axis output acceleration data in 2s complement
OUT_Y[7:0]:LSB of the 12-bit Y-axis output acceleration data in 2s complement
OUT_Y[11:8]:MSB of the 12-bit Y-axis output acceleration data in 2s complement
OUT_Z[7:0]:LSB of the 12-bit Z-axis output acceleration data in 2s complement
OUT_Z[11:8]:MSB of the 12-bit Z-axis output acceleration data in 2s complement
BUF_WMRK: 0 – The buffer watermark level not exceeded, 1 – The buffer watermark level exceeded
Bit-6 Description: BUF_OVF: 0 – Buffer overflow event has not occurred, 1 – Buffer overflow event has occurred
Bit-5 Description: BUF_CNT[5:0]: Count of the number of acceleration data triplets (samples) currently stored

Bit-7 Description: BUF_X[7:0]:LSB of the 12-bit buffer Head or Tail output acceleration sample data in 2s complement
BUF_X[11:8]:MSB of the 12-bit buffer Head or Tail output acceleration sample data in 2s complement
BUF_Y[7:0]:LSB of the 12-bit buffer Head or Tail output acceleration sample data in 2s complement
BUF_Y[11:8]:MSB of the 12-bit buffer Head or Tail output acceleration sample data in 2s complement
BUF_Z[7:0]:LSB of the 12-bit buffer Head or Tail output acceleration sample data in 2s complement
BUF_Z[11:8]:MSB of the 12-bit buffer Head or Tail output acceleration sample data in 2s complement
REV_MAJ[3:0]:Major product revision value
Bit-6 Description: REV_MIN[3:0]:Min product revision value

Bit-7 Description: WHOAMI[7:0]:NXP unique sensor product identifier
GATE_ERR: 0 - A buffer gate error has not been detected, 1 - A buffer gate error was detected
Bit-6 Description: GATE_CNT[4:0]: number of OOR periods that have elapsed since the BUF _GATE_ERR flag was asserted
Bit-5 Description: SYS_MODE[1:0]: 00 - Standby mode, 01 - WAKE mode, 10 - SLEEP mode, 11 - EXT_TRIG mode

Bit-7 Description: RST: 0 – No device reset pending, 1 – Device reset pending.
Bit-6 Description: ST_AXIS_SEL[1:0]: Self-test axis selection, 00 – Self-test function is disabled, 01 – Self-test function is enabled for X-axis, 10 - Self-test function is enabled for Y-axis, 11 - Self-test function is enabled for Z-axis
Bit-5 Description: ST_POL: 0 – Proof mass displacement for the selected axis is in the positive direction, 1 – Proof mass displacement for the selected axis is in the negative direction.
Bit-4 Description: SPI_M: 0 – 4-wire interface mode is selected, 1 – 3-wire interface mode is selected.

Bit-7 Description: WAKE_PM[1:0]: 00 – Low Power mode, 01 – High Performance mode, 1x – Flex Performance mode.
Bit-6 Description: SLEEP_PM[1:0]: 00 – Low Power mode, 01 – High Performance mode, 1x – Flex Performance mode.
Bit-3 Description: AINC_TEMP: 0 – TEMP_OUT register content is not included in auto-increment address range,1 – TEMP_OUT register content is included in auto-increment address range.
Bit-2 Description: F_READ: 0 – Normal read mode, 1 – Fast read mode.

Bit-7 Description: WAKE_ODR[3:0]:Wake mode ODR
Bit-6 Description: SLEEP_ODR[3:0]:Sleep mode ODR

Bit-7 Description: EXT_TRIG_M:External trigger function acquisition mode
Bit-6 Description: WAKE_SDCD_WT: 0 - SDCD within thresholds event is not used to prevent entry into an exit from SLEEP mode, 1 - SDCD within thresholds event is used to prevent entry into an exit from SLEEP mode
Bit-5 Description: WAKE_SDCD_OT: 0 - SDCD outside thresholds event is not used to prevent entry into an exit from SLEEP mode, 1 - SDCD outside thresholds event is used to prevent entry into an exit from SLEEP mode
Bit-4 Description: WAKE_ORIENT: 0 - Orientation change condition is not used to prevent entry into an exit from SLEEP mode, 1 - Orientation change condition is used to prevent entry into an exit from SLEEP mode
Bit-3 Description: DRDY_PUL:Pulse generation option for DRDY event
Bit-2 Description: INT2_FUNC: 0 - INT2/EXT_TRIG pin is configured for the INT2 output function, 1 - INT2/EXT_TRIG pin is configured as EXT_TRIG input function
Bit-1 Description: INT_PP_OD: 0 - INT output pin driver is push-pull type, 1 - INT output pin driver is open-drain/open-source type
column21: INT_POL: 0 - Active low INT polarity, 1 - Active high INT polarity

Bit-7 Description: UNUSED
Bit-6 Description: UNUSED

Bit-7 Description: WAKE_IDLE[7:0]:LSB of the 12-bit WAKE mode idletime
WAKE_IDLE[11:8]:MSB of the 12-bit WAKE mode idletime
SLEEP_IDLE[7:0]:LSB of the 12-bit SLEEP mode idletime
SLEEP_IDLE[11:8]:MSB of the 12-bit SLEEP mode idletime
ASLP_CNT[7:0]:LSB of the 12-bit unsigned count value used for inactivity detection
ASLP_CNT[11:8]:MSB of the 12-bit unsigned count value used for inactivity detection
DRDY_EN: 0 – Interrupt is disabled, 1 – Interrupt is enabled and signaled on either the INT1 or INT2 output
Bit-6 Description: BUF_EN: 0 – Interrupt is disabled, 1 – Interrupt is enabled and signaled on either the INT1 or INT2 output
Bit-5 Description: SDCD_OT_EN: 0 – Interrupt is disabled, 1 – Interrupt is enabled and signaled on either the INT1 or INT2 output
Bit-4 Description: SDCD_WT_EN: 0 – Interrupt is disabled, 1 – Interrupt is enabled and signaled on either the INT1 or INT2 output
Bit-3 Description: ORIENT_EN: 0 – Interrupt is disabled, 1 – Interrupt is enabled and signaled on either the INT1 or INT2 output
Bit-2 Description: ASLP_EN: 0 – Interrupt is disabled, 1 – Interrupt is enabled and signaled on either the INT1 or INT2 output pins
Bit-1 Description: BOOT_DIS: 0 – Boot interrupt is enabled and routed to either the INT1 or INT2 output pin, 1 – Interrupt is disabled and not routed to the INT output pins
column21: WAKE_OUT_EN: 0 – The device does not signal the WAKE operating mode on the INT output pin, 1 – The device signals that it is currently in WAKE mode via the INT1 or INT2 pin

Bit-7 Description: DRDY_INT2: 0 - Interrupt signal is routed to INT1 pin if it is enabled, 1 - Interrupt signal is routed to INT2 pin if it is enabled.
Bit-6 Description: BUF_INT2: 0 - Interrupt signal is routed to INT1 pin if it is enabled, 1 - Interrupt signal is routed to INT2 pin if it is enabled.
Bit-5 Description: SDCD_OT_INT2: 0 - Interrupt signal is routed to INT1 pin if it is enabled, 1 - Interrupt signal is routed to INT2 pin if it is enabled.
Bit-4 Description: SDCD_WT_INT2: 0 - Interrupt signal is routed to INT1 pin if it is enabled, 1 - Interrupt signal is routed to INT2 pin if it is enabled.
Bit-3 Description: ORIENT_INT2: 0 - Interrupt signal is routed to INT1 pin if it is enabled, 1 - Interrupt signal is routed to INT2 pin if it is enabled.
Bit-2 Description: ASLP_INT2: 0 - Interrupt signal is routed to INT1 pin if it is enabled, 1 - Interrupt signal is routed to INT2 pin if it is enabled. pins
Bit-1 Description: BOOT_DIS: 0 - Interrupt signal is routed to INT1 pin if it is enabled, 1 - Interrupt signal is routed to INT2 pin if it is enabled.
column21: WAKE_OUT_INT2: 0 - Interrupt signal is routed to INT1 pin if it is enabled, 1 - Interrupt signal is routed to INT2 pin if it is enabled.

Bit-7 Description: OFF_X[7:0]:Offset to realign the zero-g position of the X-axis.
OFF_Y[7:0]:Offset to realign the zero-g position of the Y-axis.
OFF_Z[7:0]:Offset to realign the zero-g position of the Z-axis.
BUF_TYPE: 0 - First In First Out (FIFO), 1 - First In Last Out (LIFO)
Bit-6 Description: BUF_MODE[1:0]: Buffer data collection mode 00 - Buffer is disabled, 01 - Stream Mode, 10 - Stop Mode, 11 - Trigger mode
Bit-5 Description: BUF_GATE: 0 - The Output data buffer input gate is disabled, 1 - The Output data buffer input gate is enabled
Bit-4 Description: TRIG_SDCD_WT: 0 - Trigger source is disabled, 1 - Trigger source is enabled
Bit-3 Description: TRIG_SDCD_OT: 0 - Trigger source is disabled, 1 - Trigger source is enabled
Bit-1 Description: TRIG_ORIENT: 0 - Trigger source is disabled, 1 - Trigger source is enabled

Bit-7 Description: BUF_FLUSH: 0 - No pending buffer flush operation, or buffer flush completed, 1 - Buffer flush enable
Bit-6 Description: WAKE_SRC_BUF: 0 - Buffer WAKE-to-SLEEP transition event disabled, 1 - Buffer WAKE-to-SLEEP transition event enabled

Bit-7 Description: NEW_ORIENT: 0 - No change in orientation detected, 1 - BAFRO and/or LAPO and/or Z-tilt lockout value has changed
Bit-6 Description: LO: 0 - Lockout condition has not been detected, 1 - Lockout condition has been detected
Bit-2 Description: LAPO[1:0]: 00 - Portrait up, 01 - Portrait down, 10 - Portrait right, 11: Portrait left
Bit-1 Description: BAFRO: 0 - Front: The device is in the front-facing orientation, 1 - Back: The device is in the back-facing orientation

Bit-7 Description: ORIENT_DBCNT: Orientation debounce counter mode selection
Bit-6 Description: ORIENT_ENABLE: 0 - Orientation detection function is disabled, 1 - Orientation detection function is enabled

Bit-7 Description: ORIENT_DBCNT[7:0]:Debounce count used for validating anorientation state change.
ORIENT_BKFR[1:0]: Back-up/Front-up trip angle threshold, default: 01
Bit-6 Description: UNUSED

Bit-7 Description: ORIENT_THS[4:0]: Orientation change trip thresholds
Bit-6 Description: ORIENT_HYS[2:0]: Orientation hysteris trip angle

Bit-7 Description: OT_EA: 0 – SDCD outside-of-thresholds event flag has not been asserted, 1 – SDCD outside-of-thresholds event flag has been asserted for one or more axes
Bit-6 Description: UNUSED
Bit-5 Description: X_OT_EF: 0 – X-axis data or delta is < SDCD_UTHS value and > SDCD_LTHS value, 1 – X-axis data or delta is either ≥ SDCD_UTHS value or ≤ SDCD_LTHS value
Bit-4 Description: X_OT_POL: 0 - X-axis data or delta was ≤ lower threshold value, 1 - X-axis data or delta was ≥ upper threshold value
Bit-3 Description: Y_OT_EF: 0 – Y-axis data or delta is < SDCD_UTHS value and > SDCD_LTHS value, 1 – Y-axis data or delta is either ≥ SDCD_UTHS value or ≤ SDCD_LTHS value
Bit-2 Description: Y_OT_POL: 0 - Y-axis data or delta was ≤ lower threshold value, 1 - Y-axis data or delta was ≥ upper threshold value
Bit-1 Description: Z_OT_EF: 0 – Z-axis data or delta is < SDCD_UTHS value and > SDCD_LTHS value, 1 – Z-axis data or delta is either ≥ SDCD_UTHS value or ≤ SDCD_LTHS value
column21: Z_OT_POL: 0 - Z-axis data or delta was ≤ lower threshold value, 1 - Z-axis data or delta was ≥ upper threshold value

Bit-7 Description: WT_EA: 0 – SDCD within-thresholds event flag has not been asserted, 1 – SDCD within-thresholds event flag has been asserted for one or more axes
Bit-6 Description: UNUSED
Bit-5 Description: X_WT_EF: 0 – X-axis data or delta is ≥ SDCD_UTHS value or ≤ SDCD_LTHS value, 1 – X-axis data or delta is < SDCD_UTHS and > SDCD_LTHS value
Bit-3 Description: Y_WT_EF: 0 – Y-axis data or delta is ≥ SDCD_UTHS value or ≤ SDCD_LTHS value, 1 – Y-axis data or delta is < SDCD_UTHS and > SDCD_LTHS value
column21: Z_WT_EF: 0 – Z-axis data or delta is ≥ SDCD_UTHS value or ≤ SDCD_LTHS value, 1 – Z-axis data or delta is < SDCD_UTHS and > SDCD_LTHS value

Bit-7 Description: OT_ELE: 0 - Outside of thresholds event flag latching is disabled, 1 - Outside of thresholds event flag latching is enabled
Bit-6 Description: WT_ELE: 0 - Within thresholds event flag latching is disabled, 1 - Within thresholds event flag latching is enabled
Bit-5 Description: X_OT_EN: 0 - X-axis data or delta is not used in the outside of thresholds condition evaluation, 1 - X-axis data or delta is used in the outside of thresholds condition evaluation
Bit-4 Description: Y_OT_EN: 0 - Y-axis data or delta is not used in the outside of thresholds condition evaluation, 1 - Y-axis data or delta is used in the outside of thresholds condition evaluation
Bit-3 Description: Z_OT_EN: 0 - Z-axis data or delta is not used in the outside of thresholds condition evaluation, 1 - Z-axis data or delta is used in the outside of thresholds condition evaluation
Bit-2 Description: X_WT_EN: 0 - X-axis data or delta is not used in the within thresholds condition evaluation, 1 - X-axis data or delta is used in the within thresholds condition evaluation
Bit-1 Description: Y_WT_EN: 0 - Y-axis data or delta is not used in the within thresholds condition evaluation, 1 - Y-axis data or delta is used in the within thresholds condition evaluation
column21: Z_WT_EN: 0 - Z-axis data or delta is not used in the within thresholds condition evaluation, 1 - Z-axis data or delta is used in the within thresholds condition evaluation

Bit-7 Description: SDCD_EN: 0 - SDCD function is disabled, 1 - SDCD function is enabled
Bit-6 Description: REF_UPDM[1:0]: 00 - The function stores the first 12-bit X/Y/Z decimated and trimmed input data (OUT_X/Y/Z[n=0]) asthe internal REF_X/Y/Z values after the function is enabled (SDCD_EN is set to 1). The REF_X/Y/Zvalues are updated with the current 12-bit X/Y/Z decimated input data (OUT_X/Y/Z[n]) at the time theSDCD_OT_EA flag transitions from False to True.01 - The function stores the first decimated and trimmed X/Y/Z acceleration input data (OUT_X/Y/Z[n=0]) as the internal REF_X/Y/Z values when the SDCD function is enabled; the REF_X/Y/Z valuesare then held constant and never updated until the SDCD function is disabled and subsequentlyreenabled, or asynchronously when the REF_UPD bit is set by the host.10 - The function updates the SDCD_REF_X/Y/Z values with the current decimated and trimmed X/Y/Z acceleration input data after the function evaluation. This allows for acceleration slope detectionwith Data(n) to Data(n–1) always used as the input to the window comparator.11 - The function uses a fixed value of 0 for each of the SDCD_REF_X/Y/Z registers, making the function operate in absolute comparison mode.
Bit-5 Description: OT_DBCTM: SDCD outside-of-threshold event debounce counter behavior
Bit-4 Description: WT_DBCTM: SDCD within-threshold event debounce counter behavior
Bit-3 Description: WT_LOG_SEL: 0 - Function uses the logical AND of the enabled axes, 1 - Function uses the logical OR of the enabled axes
Bit-2 Description: MODE: 0 - Function uses X,Y,Z acceleration data for the window comparison, 1 - Function uses vector magnitude data for the window comparison
Bit-1 Description: REF_UPD: SDCD synchronous X/Y/Z reference values update bit

Bit-7 Description: SDCD_OT_DBCNT[7:0]: Debounce count threshold register for SDCD outside-of-thresholds condition event detection
SDCD_WT_DBCNT[7:0]: Debounce count threshold register for SDCD within-thresholds condition event detection
SDCD_LTHS[7:0]: SDCD 12-bit 2's complement lower threshold least significant byte
SDCD_LTHS[11:8]:SDCD 12-bit 2's complement lower threshold most significant byte
SDCD_UTHS[7:0]: SDCD 12-bit 2's complement upper threshold least significant byte
SDCD_UTHS[11:8]:SDCD 12-bit 2's complement upper threshold most significant byte
ST_IDLE[4:0]:Self-Test Idle phase duration
ST_DEC[3:0]:Self-Test measurement phase decimation factor
